intro: Lessertia schlechteri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in mountainous regions. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and bloom throughout the year. Lessertia schlechteri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
